alert.note: Alert for Central Greenville; Greenville Mountains (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 28 at 10:29PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Polk, northeastern Greenville and northwestern Spartanburg Counties through 1115 PM EDT... At 1029 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles south of Columbus, or near Campobello, moving north at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Columbus, Landrum, Tryon, Campobello, Lake Bowen, Mill Spring, Gowensville, Green Creek and Lake Adger. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
